author: Mason Nesbitt
title: Hart football explodes past rival Canyon
text:
Hart football explodes past rival Canyon Indians continue hot start with a Foothill League victory Posted: October 9, 2015 11:27   9, 2015 11:27 p.m. Hart running back Nelson James (11) runs past the Canyon defense for a touchdown in the first quarteron Friday night at Canyon High School. Photo by Tom Cruze/For The Signal Canyon quarterback Miles Fallin (11) leaps as he passes the ball over Hart defensive back Vincent Gonzalez (29) in the first quarter Friday night at Canyon High School. Photo by Tom Cruze/For The Signal Hart receiver Brock Williams (21) leaps over Canyon defender Alex DeLeon (29) in the first quarter Friday night at Canyon High School. Photo by Tom Cruze/For The Signal 
Hart versus Canyon had all the craziness you’d expect from a long-time rivalry, what with two successful onside kicks, a blocked punt returned for a touchdown and five TDs of longer than 50 yards. 
But put simply, the Indians had running back Nelson James and quarterback Nick Moore. 
And did they ever deliver. 
James ran for 244 yards and four touchdowns on 20 carries, and Moore threw for 318 yards and two scores to lift the Indians to a 52-28 win over the Cowboys at Canyon High on Friday night in the teams’ Foothill League opener. 
Hart (5-1 overall, 1-0 Foothill) took a 24-7 lead to halftime behind one of James’ TDs and two passing strikes from Moore to Brock Williams. 
Williams caught nine passes for 130 yards and two TDs in the game. 
Moore finished 24-for-36 with an interception. 
Canyon QB Miles Fallin went 13-for-31 for 306 yards and three TDs of 80, 13 and 72 yards, respectively. 
The second of which went to Camden Apsay at the 8:32 mark in the third quarter to bring Canyon (1-5, 0-1) within 24-13. 
Cowboy Cole Manclow blocked a Hart punt deep in Indians territory minutes later and Jason Preece recovered it and ran it in for a touchdown to make it 24-20 Hart. 
Then it was Hart’s turn for a frenzy. 
James broke off a 65-yard touchdown run on Hart’s next play. 
Then after two more TD runs — a Moore 3-yard scamper and a James 10-yard score with a successful onside kick in between — James capped Hart’s night with a 73-yard scoring run up the right side to put the Indians up 52-20 with 7:28 to play. 
Jake Gavin caught three passes for 112 yards and a TD to lead Canyon. 
Henry Arellano carried the ball 12 times for 45 yards. 
Moore ran 14 times for 26 yards, while Ethan Lazarek caught five passes for 106 yards for Hart, which showed no letdown after a strong preleague. 
The Cowboys, coming off a brutal preleague schedule, stuck to what worked for them in the first half of their loss to St. Francis their last time out, keeping Fallin mostly under center and looking to move the ball with the run and short passes. 
But the Hart defense proved too tough, limiting Canyon to 135 total yards in the first half. 
Canyon had beaten Hart four out of their last five meetings and eight of their last 12 coming into the game. 
The loss was just Canyon head coach Rich Gutierrez’s second to the Indians in his tenure.
